properties.Name: BB1
properties.Access:
First gate is a yellow gate on 80th Street next to the Highway 17.
Follow the gate, there is a second gate that is a grey one. Go through the gate and drive ~700m then turn left.
There is the third and last gate, which is also grey.
Then go straight for ~860m, turn right at first fork.
Continue for another ~250m, cross the ditch and turn left.
The tower and boardwalks are visible on the right after another ~200m.
properties.Description: A harvested peatland that is undergoing active restoration.

properties.Name: BB2
properties.Access:
First gate is a yellow gate on 80th Street next to the Highway 17.
Follow the gate, there is a second gate that is a grey one.
Go through the gate and drive ~1.3km, there is the third and last gate, which is also grey. Then go straight for ~750m, turn left when see the flagged tree with a wood pole.
After that, follow the boardwalks and path for another ~550m, the BB2 tower is visible.
properties.Description: A harvested peatland that is not undergoing active restoration, but experiencing passive restoration.

properties.Name: DSM
properties.Access: Enter the gate through 112th Street, follow the gravel road for ~1.5km, the tower is visible on the right.
properties.Description: A degraded salt marsh in boundary bay.

properties.Name: RBM
properties.Access: Get to the West Dyke Trail through Steveston Hwy, go south about ~250m, the tower is visible on the right.
properties.Description: A brackish marsh near the mouth of the Fraser River.
